history.proof: apply Build_UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel. intros m m' n'. hauto lq: on depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
worlds: Type
R: Relation worlds

Goal:
UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel worlds

Premises:
UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel : forall worlds : Type, KI.Relation worlds -> Relation worlds -> Prop
Relation = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> worlds -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
prod_ukmM : forall (RA1 : KI.Relation ?A) (RB1 : KI.Relation ?B) (RA2 : Relation ?A) (RB2 : Relation ?B), UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel ?A -> UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel ?B -> UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel (?A * ?B) where ?A : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type] ?B : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type]
KM_relation_up : forall m m' n' : ?worlds, m <= m' -> Krelation m' n' -> exists n : ?worlds, n <= n' /\ Krelation m n where ?worlds : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type] ?R1 : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- KI.Relation ?worlds] ?R2 : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Relation ?worlds] ?UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel ?worlds]
Krelation = fun (worlds : Type) (Relation : Relation worlds) => Relation : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop Arguments worlds, Relation are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _]
Build_UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel : forall (worlds : Type) (R1 : KI.Relation worlds) (R2 : Relation worlds), (forall m m' n' : worlds, m <= m' -> Krelation m' n' -> exists n : worlds, n <= n' /\ Krelation m n) -> UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel worlds
KI.Krelation = fun (worlds : Type) (Relation : KI.Relation worlds) => Relation : forall worlds : Type, KI.Relation worlds -> worlds -> Ensembles.Ensemble worlds Arguments worlds, Relation are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
eq_sigT_hprop_iff : (forall (x : ?A) (p q : ?P x), p = q) -> forall u v : {a : ?A & ?P a}, u = v < -> projT1 u = projT1 v where ?A : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type] ?P : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- ?A -> Type]
eq_sigT_hprop : (forall (x : ?A) (p q : ?P x), p = q) -> forall u v : {a : ?A & ?P a}, projT1 u = projT1 v -> u = v where ?A : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type] ?P : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- ?A -> Type]
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type] ?B : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type]
KI.Relation = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> Ensembles.Ensemble worlds : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n)), P n v where ?A : [worlds : Type R : Relation worlds |- Type]
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z);...
PeanoNat.Nat.add_carry_div2 : forall (a b : nat) (c0 : bool), PeanoNat.Nat.div (a + b + PeanoNat.Nat.b2n c0) 2 = PeanoNat.Nat.div a 2 + PeanoNat.Nat.div b 2 + PeanoNat.Nat.b2n (PeanoNat.Nat.testbit a 0 && PeanoNat.Nat.testbit b 0 || c0 && (PeanoNat.Nat.testbit a 0 || PeanoNat.Nat.testbit b 0))
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Argument scopes are [positive_scope positive_scope]
BinPosDef.Pos.add = fix add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNums.xH end end...
OmegaLemmas.fast_Zplus_comm : forall (x y : BinNums.Z) (P : BinNums.Z -> Prop), P (BinInt.Z.add y x) -> P (BinInt.Z.add x y)
BinNat.N.sqrt_up = fun a : BinNums.N => match BinNat.N.compare BinNums.N0 a with | Lt => BinNat.N.succ (BinNat.N.sqrt (BinNat.N.pred a)) | _ => BinNums.N0 end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N
BinInt.Z.eq_mul_0 : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n m = BinNums.Z0 < -> n = BinNums.Z0 \/ m = BinNums.Z0
PeanoNat.Nat.divide_gcd_iff' : forall n m : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.divide n m < -> PeanoNat.Nat.gcd n m = n
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In = fun (i : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt) (t : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) => FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem i t = true : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> Prop
Ascii.eqb = fun a b : Ascii.ascii => match a with | Ascii.Ascii a0 a1 a2 a3 a4 a5 a6 a7 => match b with | Ascii.Ascii b0 b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 b6 b7 => if if if if if if if Bool.eqb a0 b0 then Bool.eqb a1 b1 else false then Bool.eqb a2 b2 else false then Bool.eqb a3 b3 else false then Bool.eqb a4 b4 else false then Bool.eqb a5 b5 else false then Bool.eqb a6 b6 else false then Bool.eqb a7 b7 else false end end : Ascii.ascii -> Ascii.ascii -> bool Argument scopes are [char_scope char_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Argument scope is [nat_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem = fix mem (i : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt) (m : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) {struct m} : bool := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => false | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l o r => match i with | BinNums.xI i0 => mem i0 r | BinNums.xO i0 => mem i0 l | BinNums.xH => o end end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> bool
EqdepFacts.UIP_on_ : forall (U : Type) (x y : U), x = y -> Prop
Znat.N2Z.inj : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinInt.Z.of_N n = BinInt.Z.of_N m -> n = m

```coq
apply Build_UpwardsClosedOrderedKripkeModel.
intros m m' n'.
apply KM_relation_up.
Qed.
